article.headline: Montana 78, Drake 72 (OT)
article.story: DES MOINES, Iowa (AP) -- Sophomore Andrew Strait and junior Matt Dlouhy poured in 17 points each to lead Montana past Drake 78-72 in overtime in the championship game at the Drake Regency Classic on Saturday. The Grizzlies (7-1) led 67-64 with just 13 seconds remaining when Al Stewart hit a 3-pointer for Drake (5-3) to tie the score and send the game to overtime. The score remained close during overtime, but Drake failed to score after the 1:36 mark and Montana capitalized, scoring six points off free throws by sophomore Matt Martin and senior Virgil Matthews, who finished with 15 points and six rebounds. Montana trailed 37-33 at the half. Also scoring in double digits for the Griz was senior Kevin Criswell, who had 16 points and tied a team-high four assists. Al Stewart led the Bulldogs with 13 points, followed by Ajay Calvin with 12 and Nick Grant with 11. The Grizzlies return to action on Wednesday, when they play Montana-Western at home.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
